I need to detect usage of the `org.springframework.batch.core.configuration.annotation.EnableBatchProcessing` annotation. @EnableBatchProcessing not needed anymore.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-batch-00000"
category: "optional"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.batch.core.configuration.annotation.EnableBatchProcessing"
    location: "ANNOTATION"
description: "@EnableBatchProcessing not needed anymore"
message: "Previously, `@EnableBatchProcessing` could be used to enable Spring Boot’\
  s auto-configuration of Spring Batch. It is\nno longer required and should be removed\
  \ from applications that want to use Boot’s auto-configuration. A bean that\nis\
  \ annotated with `@EnableBatchProcessing` or that extends Batch’s `DefaultBatchConfiguration`\
  \ can now be defined to\ntell the auto-configuration to back off, allowing the application\
  \ to take complete control of how Batch is configured.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Spring Batch"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#enablebatchprocessing-is-now-discouraged"
Create a rule that flags the use of the `org.springframework.batch.spring-batch-core` dependency because running multiple batch jobs is no longer supported.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-batch-00010"
category: "potential"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.dependency:
    name: "org.springframework.batch.spring-batch-core"
    lowerbound: "0.0.0"
description: "Running multiple batch jobs is no longer supported"
message: "Running multiple batch jobs is no longer supported. If the auto-configuration\
  \ detects a single job is, it will be\nexecuted on startup. If multiple jobs are\
  \ found in the context, a job name to execute on startup must be supplied\nby the\
  \ user using the `spring.batch.job.name` property.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Spring Batch"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#multiple-batch-jobs"
Create a rule to find content matching `spring\.session\.store-type` in .*\.properties. Store type explicit config no longer supported.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-batch-00020"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  builtin.filecontent:
    pattern: "spring\\.session\\.store-type"
    filePattern: ".*\\.properties"
description: "Store type explicit config no longer supported"
message: "Explicitly configuring the store type for Spring session via `spring.session.store-type`\
  \ is no longer supported.\nIn case multiple session store repository implementations\
  \ are detected on the classpath, a fixed order is used to\ndetermine which SessionRepository\
  \ should be auto-configured. If Spring Boot’s defined ordering doesn’t meet your\n\
  needs, you can define your own `SessionRepository` bean and cause the auto-configuration\
  \ to back off.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Spring batch"
  link: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#spring-session-store-type"
- title: "Spring documentation - Spring session"
  link: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.0.x/reference/html/web.html#web.spring-session"
Create a rule to detect image banner support removed.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-core-changes-00001"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  or:
  - builtin.file:
      pattern: "banner.gif"
  - builtin.file:
      pattern: "banner.jpg"
  - builtin.file:
      pattern: "banner.png"
description: "Image banner support removed"
message: "Support for image-based application banners has been removed. `banner.gif`,\
  \ `banner.jpg`,\nand `banner.png` files are now ignored and should be replaced with\
  \ a text-based `banner.txt` file.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Core changes"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#image-banner-support-removed"
Create a rule to detect usage of `*`. @ConstructorBinding no longer needed at type level.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-core-changes-00010"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "*"
    location: "CLASS"
    annotated:
      pattern: "org.springframework.boot.context.properties.ConstructorBinding"
description: "@ConstructorBinding no longer needed at type level"
message: "`@ConstructorBinding` is no longer needed at the type level on `@ConfigurationProperties`\
  \ classes and should be removed.\nWhen a class or record has multiple constructors,\
  \ it may still be used on a constructor to indicate which one should be used for\
  \ property binding.\n\nIf you were relying on autowiring of a dependency into the\
  \ constructor of a `@ConfigurationProperties` class,\nyou must now annotate it with\
  \ @Autowired to prevent it being identified as a target for property binding.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Core changes"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#constructingbinding-no-longer-needed-at-the-type-level"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.json.YamlJsonParser`. YamlJsonParser has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-core-changes-00020"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.json.YamlJsonParser"
description: "YamlJsonParser has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `YamlJsonParser` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0 because SnakeYAML's\
  \ JSON parsing was inconsistent with other parsers.\n\nIf you were using `YamlJsonParser`,\
  \ switch to one of the other implementations of Spring Boot's `JsonParser` interface:\n\
  - **`JacksonJsonParser`**: Uses Jackson to parse JSON.\n- **`BasicJsonParser`**:\
  \ Provides a simple, lightweight JSON parser (less commonly used).\n\nFor example:\n\
  - Using `JacksonJsonParser`:\n  ```\n  JsonParser parser = new JacksonJsonParser();\n\
  \  Map<String, Object> jsonMap = parser.parseMap(jsonInputString);\n  ```\n- Using\
  \ `BasicJsonParser`:\n  ```\n  JsonParser parser = new BasicJsonParser();\n  Map<String,\
  \ Object> jsonMap = parser.parseMap(jsonInputString);\n  ```\n\nEnsure to update\
  \ all usages of `YamlJsonParser` to a supported `JsonParser` implementation.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#yamljsonparser"
- title: "JacksonJsonParser Documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/json/JacksonJsonParser.html"
- title: "BasicJsonParser Documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spri"
Write a rule to identify `spring.factories` files - autoconfiguration mechanism has changed.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-core-changes-00030"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  builtin.file:
    pattern: "spring.factories"
description: "Autoconfiguration mechanism has changed"
message: "In Spring Boot 3.0, the `spring.factories` file can no longer be used to\
  \ register\nauto-configuration classes under the `EnableAutoConfiguration` key.\
  \ Instead, these classes\nmust be listed in the new `AutoConfiguration.imports`\
  \ file.\n\nPlease migrate the entries as follows:\n\n1. Identify all auto-configuration\
  \ classes listed under the `EnableAutoConfiguration` key in `spring.factories`.\n\
  2. Create a new file: `META-INF/spring/org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.AutoConfiguration.imports`.\n\
  3. Copy the auto-configuration class entries into the `AutoConfiguration.imports`\
  \ file.\n4. Remove or comment out the `EnableAutoConfiguration` key and its entries\
  \ from `spring.factories`.\n\nIf your library must support both Spring Boot 2.x\
  \ and 3.x, you can list the classes in both files.\nSpring Boot 2.7 will handle\
  \ this gracefully by deduplicating entries.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Autoconfiguration files"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#auto-configuration-files"
Create a rule to find content matching `spring\.data` in .*\.properties. Spring data properties.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-datasource-00000"
category: "potential"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  builtin.filecontent:
    filePattern: ".*\\.properties"
    pattern: "spring\\.data"
description: "Spring data properties"
message: "The `spring.data` prefix has been reserved for Spring Data and any properties\
  \ under the prefix imply\nthat Spring Data is required on the classpath.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Changes to data properties"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#changes-to-data-properties"
Create a rule that flags the use of the `org.flywaydb.flyway-core` dependency because spring boot 3.0 uses flyway 9.0 by default.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-datasource-00010"
category: "potential"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.dependency:
    name: "org.flywaydb.flyway-core"
    upperbound: "8.9999.999999"
description: "Spring Boot 3.0 uses Flyway 9.0 by default"
message: "Spring Boot 3.0 uses Flyway 9.0 by default. Please see the Flyway release\
  \ notes and blog post to learn how this\nmay affect your application.\n\nFlywayConfigurationCustomizer\
  \ beans are now called to customize the FluentConfiguration after any Callback and\n\
  JavaMigration beans have been added to the configuration. An application that defines\
  \ Callback and JavaMigration\nbeans and adds callbacks and Java migrations using\
  \ a customizer may have to be updated to ensure that the intended\ncallbacks and\
  \ Java migrations are used.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Flyway"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#flyway"
- title: "Flyway - Release notes"
  url: "https://flywaydb.org/documentation/learnmore/releaseNotes#9.0.0"
- title: "Flyway - Blog post"
  url: "https://flywaydb.org/blog/version-9-is-coming-what-developers-need-to-know"

Create a rule that flags the use of the `de.flapdoodle.embed.de.flapdoodle.embed.mongo` dependency because autoconfiguration for flapdoodle has been removed.

- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"

    lowerbound: "0.0.0"

  \ has been removed. If you are using\nembedded MongoDB for testing, use the auto-configuration\
  \ library provided by the Flapdoodle project or modify\nthe tests to use the Testcontainers\
  \ project instead of embedded MongoDB.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Embedded MongoDB"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#embedded-mongodb"

Create a rule to find content matching `r2dbc-bom\.version` in pom\.xml. R2DBC bom no longer available.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-datasource-00050"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  builtin.filecontent:
    filePattern: "pom\\.xml"
    pattern: "r2dbc-bom\\.version"
description: "R2DBC bom no longer available"
message: "Spring Boot 3.0 uses R2DBC 1.0 by default. With the 1.0 release, R2DBC no\
  \ longer publishes a bill of materials (bom) which has affected Spring Boot’s dependency\
  \ management. The r2dbc-bom.version can no longer be used to override R2DBC’s version.\
  \ In its place, several new properties for the individual and separately versioned\
  \ modules are now available:\n\n- `oracle-r2dbc.version` (`com.oracle.database.r2dbc:oracle-r2dbc)`\n\
  - `r2dbc-h2.version` (`io.r2dc:r2dbc-h2)`\n- `r2dbc-pool.version` (`io.r2dc:r2dbc-pool)`\n\
  - `r2dbc-postgres.version` (`io.r2dc:r2dbc-postgres)`\n- `r2dbc-proxy.version` (`io.r2dc:r2dbc-proxy)`\n\
  - `r2dbc-spi.version` (`io.r2dc:r2dbc-spi)`\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - R2DBC 1.0"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#r2dbc-10"
Create a rule that flags the use of the `org.elasticsearch.client.elasticsearch-rest-high-level-client` dependency because elasticsearch high level rest client no longer supported.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-datasource-00060"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 5
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.dependency:
    name: "org.elasticsearch.client.elasticsearch-rest-high-level-client"
    lowerbound: "0.0.0"
description: "Elasticsearch high level REST client no longer supported"
message: "Support for Elasticsearch’s high-level REST client has been removed. In\
  \ its place, auto-configuration\nfor Elasticsearch’s new Java client has been introduced.\
  \ Similarly, support for the Spring Data Elasticsearch\ntemplates that built on\
  \ top of the high-level REST client has been removed. In its place, auto-configuration\n\
  for the new templates that build upon the new Java client has been introduced. See\
  \ the Elasticsearch section\nof the reference documentation for further details.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - R2DBC 1.0"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#elasticsearch-clients-and-templates"
- title: "Spring Elasticsearch docs"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.0.x/reference/html/data.html#data.nosql.elasticsearch"

Write a rule to detect imports of `org.springframework.boot.jdbc.AbstractDataSourceInitializer`. AbstractDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0..

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00010"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.jdbc.AbstractDataSourceInitializer"
    location: "IMPORT"
description: "AbstractDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0."
message: "The class `AbstractDataSourceInitializer` has been removed in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\nThis class was previously used to initialize a `DataSource` with SQL scripts.\
  \ To migrate:\n\n1. **Replace Type Usages**: If your code directly references `AbstractDataSourceInitializer`\n\
  \   (e.g., as a superclass or declared type), update those references to use `DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\n\
  \n2. **Adjust Method Calls**: Review method overrides or calls associated with `AbstractDataSourceInitializer`\n\
  \   and adapt them for `DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`. The new class has\
  \ updated methods for improved\n   SQL script initialization.\n\n3. **Refactor Configuration**:\
  \ If your application uses custom configuration to manage `AbstractDataSourceInitializer`,\n\
  \   ensure the configuration aligns with the new `DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`\
  \ API. This may involve\n   adapting bean definitions or properties.\n\nBy following\
  \ these steps, you can transition to the modern `DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`\
  \ class, which provides\nenhanced functionality and aligns with Spring Boot 3.0's\
  \ updated practices for SQL script initialization.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer API Documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/jdbc/init/DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer.html"
Create a rule to find classes that extend `org.springframework.boot.jdbc.AbstractDataSourceInitializer`. AbstractDataSourceInitializer inheritance is no longer supported in Spring Boot 3.0..

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00020"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.jdbc.AbstractDataSourceInitializer"
    location: "INHERITANCE"
description: "AbstractDataSourceInitializer inheritance is no longer supported in\
  \ Spring Boot 3.0."
message: "The class `AbstractDataSourceInitializer` has been removed in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\nIf your application extends `AbstractDataSourceInitializer`, refactor your\
  \ code to use\n`DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer` or an equivalent custom solution.\n\
  \nThe new `DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer` class provides a more modern and\
  \ flexible API\nfor initializing a `DataSource` with SQL scripts. Evaluate whether\
  \ extending the class is still\nnecessary or if using its composition features directly\
  \ suffices.\n\nMigration Steps:\n- Replace `extends AbstractDataSourceInitializer`\
  \ with `DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\n- Update any overridden methods or\
  \ class-level configurations to align with the new class.\n- Review documentation\
  \ to configure `DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer` correctly.\n\nThis migration\
  \ ensures compatibility with Spring Boot 3.0 and takes advantage of improvements\
  \ in\nSQL script initialization practices.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer API Documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/jdbc/init/DataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.batch.BatchDataSourceInitializer`. BatchDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00030"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.batch.BatchDataSourceInitializer"
description: "BatchDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `BatchDataSourceInitializer` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\n\
  It was previously used to initialize a `DataSource` for batch processing in Spring\
  \ Batch.\n\nTo migrate, replace usages of `BatchDataSourceInitializer` with `BatchDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\n\
  The new `BatchDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer` provides improved support for\
  \ batch-specific database\ninitialization scripts, aligning with updated practices\
  \ in Spring Boot 3.0.\n\nSteps for migration:\n- Replace any instantiation or autowiring\
  \ of `BatchDataSourceInitializer` with `BatchDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\n\
  - Verify the configuration of your batch initialization scripts to ensure compatibility\
  \ with the new class.\n- Update your `application.properties` or `application.yml`\
  \ if needed, to use the updated settings for database initialization.\n\nRefer to\
  \ the migration guide and API documentation for additional details and examples.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "BatchDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/autoconfigure/batch/BatchDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.context.config.ConfigFileApplicationListener`. ConfigFileApplicationListener has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00040"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 4
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.context.config.ConfigFileApplicationListener"
description: "ConfigFileApplicationListener has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `ConfigFileApplicationListener` has been removed in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\nThis class was previously used for processing configuration files during\
  \ application startup.\n\nTo migrate, replace usages of `ConfigFileApplicationListener`\
  \ with `ConfigDataEnvironmentPostProcessor`.\nThe new `ConfigDataEnvironmentPostProcessor`\
  \ is part of Spring Boot's revamped `ConfigData` API,\nwhich offers better support\
  \ for handling configuration data across different environments.\n\nSteps for migration:\n\
  1. Remove references to `ConfigFileApplicationListener` in your code, as it is no\
  \ longer supported.\n2. If you were customizing or extending its behavior, migrate\
  \ to the `ConfigDataEnvironmentPostProcessor` and\n   use the `ConfigData` API to\
  \ handle configuration data.\n3. Review your configuration file handling, as the\
  \ `ConfigData` API introduces changes in how property sources\n   and profiles are\
  \ loaded. Ensure compatibility with the updated processing logic.\n\nRefer to the\
  \ migration guide and API documentation for examples and further details.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#config-data-api"
- title: "ConfigDataEnvironmentPostProcessor API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/context/config/ConfigDataEnvironmentPostProcessor.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.actuate.elasticsearch.ElasticsearchRestHealthIndicator`. ElasticsearchRestHealthIndicator has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00050"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.actuate.elasticsearch.ElasticsearchRestHealthIndicator"
description: "ElasticsearchRestHealthIndicator has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `ElasticsearchRestHealthIndicator` has been removed in Spring\
  \ Boot 3.0.\nThis class was used for health checks in applications using Elasticsearch.\n\
  \nTo migrate, replace usages of `ElasticsearchRestHealthIndicator` with `ElasticsearchRestClientHealthIndicator`.\n\
  The new `ElasticsearchRestClientHealthIndicator` works with the `ElasticsearchRestClient`\
  \ and provides updated\nhealth-check functionality for Elasticsearch in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\n\nIf you were directly instantiating `ElasticsearchRestHealthIndicator`,\
  \ update your configuration to use the\n`ElasticsearchRestClientHealthIndicator`\
  \ and ensure your Elasticsearch client setup aligns with the changes in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\n\nIf you were relying on Spring Boot's auto-configuration, verify your `ElasticsearchRestClient`\
  \ setup in the application\ncontext, as the auto-configured health indicator now\
  \ uses the new class.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "ElasticsearchRestClientHealthIndicator API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/actuate/elasticsearch/ElasticsearchRestClientHealthIndicator.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.integration.IntegrationDataSourceInitializer`. IntegrationDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00060"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.integration.IntegrationDataSourceInitializer"
description: "IntegrationDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `IntegrationDataSourceInitializer` has been removed in Spring\
  \ Boot 3.0.\nIt was previously used for initializing an `IntegrationDataSource`\
  \ with SQL scripts.\n\nTo migrate, replace usages of `IntegrationDataSourceInitializer`\
  \ with `IntegrationDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\nThe new class provides\
  \ enhanced support for initializing an `IntegrationDataSource` in line with modern\n\
  Spring Boot conventions.\n\nSteps for migration:\n1. Remove all references to `IntegrationDataSourceInitializer`\
  \ in your code.\n2. Use `IntegrationDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer` instead.\
  \ This class can be used\n   to initialize your integration-related data sources\
  \ with the appropriate SQL scripts.\n3. Update your configurations and scripts to\
  \ align with the new initializer's API and behavior.\n4. Test your application thoroughly\
  \ to ensure compatibility and proper data source initialization.\n\nRefer to the\
  \ migration guide and the API documentation for additional guidance and examples.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "IntegrationDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/autoconfigure/integration/IntegrationDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.session.JdbcSessionDataSourceInitializer`. JdbcSessionDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00070"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.session.JdbcSessionDataSourceInitializer"
description: "JdbcSessionDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `JdbcSessionDataSourceInitializer` has been removed in Spring\
  \ Boot 3.0.\nThis class was previously used to initialize `JdbcSessionDataSource`\
  \ for session management with SQL scripts.\n\nTo migrate, replace usages of `JdbcSessionDataSourceInitializer`\
  \ with `JdbcSessionDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\nThe new class aligns with\
  \ updated Spring Boot practices for initializing `JdbcSessionDataSource` instances\
  \ using SQL scripts.\n\nSteps for migration:\n1. Search your codebase for any references\
  \ to `JdbcSessionDataSourceInitializer` and remove them.\n2. Replace these references\
  \ with `JdbcSessionDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\n3. Update your configuration\
  \ or initialization logic to use the new class's API.\n4. Verify the SQL scripts\
  \ and ensure compatibility with `JdbcSessionDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\n\
  5. Test session management thoroughly to confirm proper initialization and behavior.\n\
  \nFor more details, consult the migration guide and the updated API documentation.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "JdbcSessionDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/autoconfigure/session/JdbcSessionDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.quartz.QuartzDataSourceInitializer`. QuartzDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00080"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.quartz.QuartzDataSourceInitializer"
description: "QuartzDataSourceInitializer has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `QuartzDataSourceInitializer` has been removed in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\nPreviously, this class was used for initializing a Quartz `DataSource` with\
  \ SQL scripts.\n\nTo migrate, replace usages of `QuartzDataSourceInitializer` with\
  \ `QuartzDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\nThe new class aligns with updated\
  \ Spring Boot practices for initializing Quartz `DataSource` instances.\n\nSteps\
  \ for migration:\n1. Identify all references to `QuartzDataSourceInitializer` in\
  \ your code.\n2. Replace these references with `QuartzDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\n\
  3. Update your configuration or initialization logic to accommodate the API changes\
  \ in the new class.\n4. Verify the SQL scripts and ensure they are compatible with\
  \ `QuartzDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`.\n5. Test Quartz job scheduling to\
  \ confirm proper initialization and behavior.\n\nNote: The new `QuartzDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer`\
  \ provides improved support for database script execution,\naligning with modern\
  \ Spring Boot practices.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "QuartzDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/autoconfigure/quartz/QuartzDataSourceScriptDatabaseInitializer.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.orm.jpa.hibernate.SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy`. SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00090"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.orm.jpa.hibernate.SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy"
description: "SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy` has been removed in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\nThis class was previously used for defining naming strategies for Hibernate\
  \ entities,\nconverting Java entity names to database table and column names.\n\n\
  To migrate, replace usages of `SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy` with `CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy`:\n\
  1. Identify all occurrences of `SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy` in your codebase,\
  \ including JPA or Hibernate configurations.\n2. Update your Hibernate configuration\
  \ or `application.properties`/`application.yml` files to use `CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy`\
  \ instead.\n3. If you were customizing `SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy`, ensure that\
  \ the custom logic is ported to a new naming strategy class or implemented using\
  \ `CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy`.\n\nExample migration:\nReplace:\n  spring.jpa.hibernate.naming.physical-strategy=org.springframework.boot.orm.jpa.hibernate.SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy\n\
  With:\n  spring.jpa.hibernate.naming.physical-strategy=org.springframework.boot.orm.jpa.hibernate.CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy\n\
  \nNote: `CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy` follows the same logic of converting\
  \ camel-case names to underscore-separated names\nbut aligns with modern Spring\
  \ Boot naming practices.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#hibernate-and-jpa"
- title: "CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/orm/6.6/javadocs/org/hibernate/boot/model/naming/CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.web.reactive.WebFluxProperties.Cookie`. WebFluxProperties.Cookie has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0..

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00100"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.web.reactive.WebFluxProperties.Cookie"
description: "WebFluxProperties.Cookie has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0."
message: "The class `WebFluxProperties.Cookie` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\n\
  To migrate, use the `Cookie` class directly from the appropriate package.\n\nSpring\
  \ Boot 3 introduces changes to how WebFlux cookie settings are configured.\nInstead\
  \ of using `WebFluxProperties.Cookie`, you can directly reference the `Cookie` class\
  \ to configure cookie settings.\n\nUpdate your code to:\n1. Replace references to\
  \ `WebFluxProperties.Cookie` with `Cookie`.\n2. Ensure that your configuration and\
  \ settings for cookies, such as their name, path, and security attributes, are properly\
  \ configured using the `Cookie` class.\n\nExample usage in your configuration:\n\
  ```java\nimport org.springframework.boot.web.servlet.Cookie;\n\nCookie cookie =\
  \ new Cookie(\"name\", \"value\");\ncookie.setMaxAge(3600);\ncookie.setPath(\"/\"\
  );\n```\n\nIf you were using the `WebFluxProperties.Cookie` class for advanced WebFlux-specific\
  \ cookie configurations, you should review your application and adapt it to use\
  \ the new `Cookie` class appropriately in your reactive setup.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide"
- title: "Cookie class documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.0.0-M4/api/org/springframework/boot/web/server/Cookie.html"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.web.reactive.WebFluxProperties.Session`. WebFluxProperties.Session has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0..

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00110"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.web.reactive.WebFluxProperties.Session"
description: "WebFluxProperties.Session has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0."
message: "The class `WebFluxProperties.Session` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.
\
  To migrate, replace usages of `WebFluxProperties.Session` with `server.reactive.session`\
  \ configuration.

In Spring Boot 3, the session-related configuration for WebFlux\
  \ applications has been moved to a new location: `server.reactive.session`.
This\
  \ change provides more flexibility in how session settings are configured for reactive\
  \ applications.

To migrate:
1. Replace any references to `WebFluxProperties.Session`\
  \ with the appropriate configuration under `server.reactive.session`.
2. You can\
  \ now configure properties like session timeout, cookie settings, and others directly\
  \ through the `server.reactive.session` section in your `application.properties`\
  \ or `application.yml`.

Example migration:

If you had the following configuration\
  \ in Spring Boot 2:
```java
@Configuration
public class WebFluxConfig {
   \
  \ @Bean
    public WebFluxProperties.Session sessionConfig() {
        WebFluxProperties.Session\
  \ session = new WebFluxProperties.Session();
        session.setTimeout(Duration.ofMinutes(30));
\
  \        return session;
    }
}
```

You should update it to use the `server.reactive.session`\
  \ properties, like so:
```yaml
server:
  reactive:
    session:
      timeout:\
  \ 30m
```

Review your `application.properties` or `application.yml` and replace\
  \ any references to `WebFluxProperties.Session` with the new configuration format\
  \ under `server.reactive.session`.
"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide"
- title: "Reactive session configuration documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/reference/htmlsingle/#reactive-web-session"
Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.jdbc.DataSourceInitializationMode`. DataSourceInitializationMode has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0..

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00120"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.jdbc.DataSourceInitializationMode"
description: "DataSourceInitializationMode has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0."
message: "The class `DataSourceInitializationMode` has been removed in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.
To migrate, replace usages of `DataSourceInitializationMode` with `DatabaseInitializationMode`.
\
  
In Spring Boot 3, the `DataSourceInitializationMode` class has been renamed to\
  \ `DatabaseInitializationMode`, which represents the same concept of controlling\
  \ how database initialization is handled.

To migrate:
1. Replace all occurrences\
  \ of `DataSourceInitializationMode` with `DatabaseInitializationMode`.
2. Update\
  \ your configuration to use `DatabaseInitializationMode` where applicable (e.g.,\
  \ in annotations, beans, or properties).

Example migration:

If you had the\
  \ following configuration in Spring Boot 2:
```java
@Configuration
public class\
  \ DatabaseConfig {
    @Bean
    public DataSource dataSource() {
        DataSourceBuilder\
  \ dataSourceBuilder = DataSourceBuilder.create();
        dataSourceBuilder.initializationMode(DataSourceInitializationMode.ALWAYS);
\
  \        return dataSourceBuilder.build();
    }
}
```

You should update it\
  \ to use the new `DatabaseInitializationMode` like so:
```java
@Configuration
\
  public class DatabaseConfig {
    @Bean
    public DataSource dataSource() {
\
  \        DataSourceBuilder dataSourceBuilder = DataSourceBuilder.create();
   \
  \     dataSourceBuilder.initializationMode(DatabaseInitializationMode.ALWAYS);
\
  \        return dataSourceBuilder.build();
    }
}
```

Be sure to also check\
  \ any property files (such as `application.properties` or `application.yml`) where\
  \ `DataSourceInitializationMode` might be referenced and replace it with `DatabaseInitializationMode`.
"

Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.actuate.autoconfigure.endpoint.expose.IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes`. IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0..

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00130"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.actuate.autoconfigure.endpoint.expose.IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes"
description: "IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes has been removed in Spring\
  \ Boot 3.0."
message: "The class `IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes` has been removed\
  \ in Spring Boot 3.0. 
To migrate, replace usages of `IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes`\
  \ with `EndpointExposure`.

In Spring Boot 3, the `DefaultIncludes` class in `IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter`\
  \ has been replaced by `EndpointExposure`, which provides more flexible configuration\
  \ for controlling which endpoints are exposed or excluded.

To migrate:
1. Replace\
  \ all references to `IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes` with `EndpointExposure`.
\
  2. Update your configuration to use `EndpointExposure` to control which endpoints\
  \ should be exposed.

Example migration:

If you had the following configuration\
  \ in Spring Boot 2:
```java
@Configuration
public class ActuatorConfig {
  \
  \  @Bean
    public IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter includeExcludeEndpointFilter()\
  \ {
        return new IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter(
            new IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes());
\
  \    }
}
```

You should update it to use `EndpointExposure` like so:
```java
\
  @Configuration
public class ActuatorConfig {
    @Bean
    public EndpointExposure\
  \ endpointExposure() {
        return EndpointExposure.ALL;
    }
}
```

\
  Also, check any properties files (such as `application.properties` or `application.yml`)\
  \ where `IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes` might be referenced and replace\
  \ it with `EndpointExposure`.
"

Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.web.reactive.WebFluxProperties.SameSite`. WebFluxProperties.SameSite has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0..

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00140"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.web.reactive.WebFluxProperties.SameSite"
description: "WebFluxProperties.SameSite has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0."
message: "The class `WebFluxProperties.SameSite` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.
\
  To migrate, replace usages of `WebFluxProperties.SameSite` with `Cookie.SameSite`.
\
  
In Spring Boot 3, cookie settings have been streamlined, and the `SameSite` attribute\
  \ is now configured using `Cookie.SameSite`. This class provides a more consistent\
  \ and flexible way to define the SameSite policy for cookies used in the application.
\
  
To migrate:
1. Replace references to `WebFluxProperties.SameSite` with `Cookie.SameSite`.
\
  2. Update your code to configure cookies according to the new `Cookie.SameSite`\
  \ enum values.

Example migration:

If you had the following configuration in\
  \ Spring Boot 2:
```java
@Configuration
public class WebConfig {
    @Bean
\
  \    public WebFluxProperties webFluxProperties() {
        WebFluxProperties properties\
  \ = new WebFluxProperties();
        properties.setSameSite(WebFluxProperties.SameSite.LAX);
\
  \        return properties;
    }
}
```

You should update it to use `Cookie.SameSite`\
  \ like so:
```java
@Configuration
public class WebConfig {
    @Bean
    public\
  \ ServerHttpCookieManager serverHttpCookieManager() {
        ServerHttpCookieManager\
  \ cookieManager = new ServerHttpCookieManager();
        cookieManager.setSameSite(Cookie.SameSite.LAX);
\
  \        return cookieManager;
    }
}
```

Also, check any properties files\
  \ (such as `application.properties` or `application.yml`) where `WebFluxProperties.SameSite`\
  \ might be referenced and replace it with `Cookie.SameSite`.
"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide"
- title: "Cookie.SameSite API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.0.0-M4/api/org/springframework/boot/web/server/Cookie.SameSite.html"

when:

description: "LocalRSocketServerPort has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0."
message: "The class `LocalRSocketServerPort` from `org.springframework.boot.rsocket.context`\
  \ has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.
To migrate, replace usages of `LocalRSocketServerPort`\
  \ from `org.springframework.boot.rsocket.context` with the new `LocalRSocketServerPort`\
  \ from `org.springframework.boot.test.rsocket`.

The class `org.springframework.boot.test.rsocket.LocalRSocketServerPort`\
  \ provides similar functionality for managing the local RSocket server port in test\
  \ configurations.

To migrate:
1. Replace any references to `org.springframework.boot.rsocket.context.LocalRSocketServerPort`\
  \ with `org.springframework.boot.test.rsocket.LocalRSocketServerPort`.
2. Update\
  \ any code or configuration files that use `LocalRSocketServerPort` accordingly.
\
  
Example migration:

If you had the following configuration in Spring Boot 2:
\
  ```java
@Configuration
public class RSocketConfig {
    @Value("${rsocket.server.port}"\
  )
    private int serverPort;

    @Bean
    public LocalRSocketServerPort localRSocketServerPort()\
  \ {
        return new LocalRSocketServerPort(serverPort);
    }
}
```

You\
  \ should update it to use `org.springframework.boot.test.rsocket.LocalRSocketServerPort`\
  \ like so:
```java
@Configuration
public class RSocketConfig {
    @Value("\
  ${rsocket.server.port}")
    private int serverPort;

    @Bean
    public\
  \ LocalRSocketServerPort localRSocketServerPort() {
        return new LocalRSocketServerPort(serverPort);
\
  \    }
}
```

Ensure that you import the correct class:
```java
import org.springframework.boot.test.rsocket.LocalRSocketServerPort;
\
  ```
"
links:

  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide"

  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.0.0-M4/api/org/springframework/boot/test/rsocket/server/LocalRSocketServerPort.html"

To migrate, replace usages of `LocalServerPort`\
  \ from `org.springframework.boot.web.server` with the new `LocalServerPort` from\
  \ `org.springframework.boot.test.web.server`.

The class `org.springframework.boot.test.web.server.LocalServerPort`\
  \ is the new location for managing the local server port in test configurations.
\
  
To migrate:
1. Replace any references to `org.springframework.boot.web.server.LocalServerPort`\
  \ with `org.springframework.boot.test.web.server.LocalServerPort`.
2. Update any\
  \ code or configuration files that use `LocalServerPort` accordingly.

Example\
  \ migration:

If you had the following configuration in Spring Boot 2:
```java
\

public class WebConfig {
    @LocalServerPort
    private int\
  \ serverPort;

    @Bean
    public int serverPort() {
        return serverPort;
\
  \    }
}
```

You should update it to use `org.springframework.boot.test.web.server.LocalServerPort`\
  \ like so:
```java
@Configuration
public class WebConfig {
    @LocalServerPort
\
  \    private int serverPort;

    @Bean
    public int serverPort() {
     \
  \   return serverPort;
    }
}
```

Ensure that you import the correct class:
\

import org.springframework.boot.test.web.server.LocalServerPort;
```
"

Create a rule to find calls to `org.springframework.boot.test.context.assertj.ApplicationContextAssertProvider.assertThat()`. The method `assertThat()` from `ApplicationContextAssertProvider` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0..

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00180"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.test.context.assertj.ApplicationContextAssertProvider.assertThat()"
    location: "METHOD_CALL"
description: "The method `assertThat()` from `ApplicationContextAssertProvider` has\
  \ been removed in Spring Boot 3.0."
message: "The method `assertThat()` from `org.springframework.boot.test.context.assertj.ApplicationContextAssertProvider`\
  \ has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.
To migrate, replace calls to `assertThat()`\
  \ from `ApplicationContextAssertProvider` with `assertThat(context)` from AssertJ.
\
  
The `assertThat(context)` method from AssertJ is the new way to assert conditions\
  \ on the Spring application context. It provides similar functionality with a modern\
  \ API.

To migrate:
1. Replace any calls to `ApplicationContextAssertProvider.assertThat()`\
  \ with `assertThat(context)`.
2. Ensure that you have the correct AssertJ import:\
  \ `import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.assertThat;`.

Example migration:
\
  
If you had the following code in Spring Boot 2:
```java
@Autowired
private\
  \ ApplicationContext context;

@Test
public void testContext() {
    assertThat(context).isNotNull();
\
  }
```

You should update it to use AssertJ like so:
```java
@Autowired
private\
  \ ApplicationContext context;

@Test
public void testContext() {
    assertThat(context).isNotNull();
\
  }
```

Ensure that you import the correct AssertJ method:
```java
import static\
  \ org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.assertThat;
```
"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide"

  url: "https://assertj.github.io/doc/"

description: "SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy` has been removed in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\nThis class was traditionally used to customize Hibernate's naming strategy\
  \ for JPA entities.\n\nTo migrate, replace usages of `SpringPhysicalNamingStrategy`\
  \ with `CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy`.\nThe new `CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy`\
  \ provides a similar functionality that converts CamelCase entity names to underscores,\n\
  ensuring compatibility with standard database naming conventions.\n\nUpdate your\
  \ code to use `CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy` instead, and ensure you configure\
  \ it properly within your JPA setup, typically in\nyour `application.properties`\
  \ or `application.yml` file.\n\nIf you had previously customized the naming strategy,\
  \ review your configuration for any specific requirements that may need adjustment\
  \ with this new alternative.\n"

  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"

  url: "https://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/orm/6.6/javadocs/org/hibernate/boot/model/naming/CamelCaseToUnderscoresNamingStrategy.html"

  \ `org.springframework.boot.test.web.server.LocalServerPort`.\n\nThe new class `org.springframework.boot.test.web.server.LocalServerPort`\
  \ provides similar functionality for test scenarios.\nEnsure your test class is\
  \ properly annotated with `@SpringBootTest`, and update any method parameters to\
  \ use the new `LocalServerPort` where needed.\n\nHere’s a quick example of the migration:\n\
  ```java\n@SpringBootTest(webEnvironment = WebEnvironment.RANDOM_PORT)\npublic class\
  \ MyApplicationTests {\n    @LocalServerPort\n    private int port;\n\n    // Your\
  \ test methods here\n}\n```\n"

  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"

Create a rule to find calls to `org.springframework.boot.test.json.JsonContent.assertThat()`. JsonContent.assertThat() has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

  Instead, you can use the AssertJ method `assertThat(context)` for asserting JSON\
  \ content.\n\nTo migrate, replace calls to `JsonContent.assertThat(jsonContent)`\
  \ with `assertThat(jsonContent).isEqualTo(expectedJson)` or any other appropriate\
  \ assertion from the AssertJ library that matches your use case. Ensure you are\
  \ importing the correct AssertJ classes to utilize its fluent assertion capabilities\
  \ effectively.\n\nAdditionally, you may need to review any related assertions and\
  \ adapt them accordingly to align with AssertJ's assertThat API, as it may have\
  \ different method signatures or requirements.\n"

Create a rule to find calls to `org.springframework.boot.loader.Launcher.createClassLoader`. createClassLoader(List<Archive>) has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00310"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 2
labels:

- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.loader.Launcher.createClassLoader"
    location: "METHOD_CALL"
description: "createClassLoader(List<Archive>) has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The method `createClassLoader(List<Archive>)` has been removed in Spring\
  \ Boot 3.0.\nYou should replace its usage with `createClassLoader(Iterator)` instead.\n\
  \nTo migrate, update your code to convert the `List<Archive>` into an `Iterator<Archive>`.\n\
  This can typically be done using the `listIterator()` method or the `iterator()`\
  \ method on the list.\nEnsure that any code that previously relied on the specific\
  \ characteristics of `List` is properly adjusted to use `Iterator`.\n\nHere’s an\
  \ example of how you can rewrite the code:\n\n```java\n// Old code\nList<Archive>\
  \ archives = ...; // your list of archives\nClassLoader classLoader = Launcher.createClassLoader(archives);\n\
  \n// New code\nIterator<Archive> archivesIterator = archives.iterator();\nClassLoader\
  \ classLoader = Launcher.createClassLoader(archivesIterator);\n```\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"

  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.0.0-M4/api/org/springframework/boot/loader/Launcher.html"

Create a rule to find calls to `org.springframework.boot.loader.archive.Archive.forEach`. The method forEach has been removed from Archive in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00330"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.loader.archive.Archive.forEach"
    location: "METHOD_CALL"
description: "The method forEach has been removed from Archive in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The method `Archive.forEach(Consumer<? super Archive.Entry>)` has been removed\
  \ in Spring Boot 3.0.\nThis method was previously used for iterating over each entry\
  \ in an archive.\n\nTo migrate, replace calls to `Archive.forEach` with the equivalent\
  \ functionality provided by `JarFile`.\nYou can create a `JarFile` instance on your\
  \ archive, and then use the `entries()` method to obtain an enumeration of the ZIP\
  \ file entries, which you can iterate through using a `while` loop or a similar\
  \ construct.\n\nHere's an example of the migration:\n\n```java\n// Old code using\
  \ Archive.forEach\narchive.forEach(entry -> {\n    // Process each entry\n});\n\n\
  // New code using JarFile\ntry (JarFile jarFile = new JarFile(archivePath)) {\n\
  \    Enumeration<JarEntry> entries = jarFile.entries();\n    while (entries.hasMoreElements())\
  \ {\n        JarEntry entry = entries.nextElement();\n        // Process each entry\n\
  \    }\n} catch (IOException e) {\n    // Handle exception\n}\n```\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "JarFile API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/jar/JarFile.html"

message: "The method `getNestedArchives(Archive.EntryFilter)` has been removed from\
  \ the `Archive` class in Spring Boot 3.0.\nInstead, you should use the new method\
  \ signature: `getNestedArchives(EntryFilter, EntryFilter)`.\n\nThis new method allows\
  \ you to specify two filters, both of type `EntryFilter`, which provides more flexibility\
  \ in defining\nhow nested archives are filtered. To migrate:\n\n- Update your method\
  \ calls from `getNestedArchives(Archive.EntryFilter)` to `getNestedArchives(EntryFilter,\
  \ EntryFilter)`.\n- You need to provide two `EntryFilter` instances, which can be\
  \ the same or different, depending on your desired filtering criteria.\n"

  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"

Create a rule to find calls to `org.springframework.boot.loader.archive.Archive.iterator`. Archive.iterator() has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-00660"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.loader.archive.Archive.iterator"
    location: "METHOD_CALL"
description: "Archive.iterator() has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The method `Archive.iterator()` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\nThis\
  \ method was used to iterate over the elements of the `Archive` class.\nTo migrate,\
  \ you should now use `JarFile` to access jar files directly.\n\nYou can obtain an\
  \ instance of `JarFile` using the `java.util.jar.JarFile` class,\nand then use its\
  \ methods to access the entries in the JAR file. For example:\n\n```java\ntry (JarFile\
  \ jarFile = new JarFile(\"path/to/your/archive.jar\")) {\n    Enumeration<JarEntry>\
  \ entries = jarFile.entries();\n    while (entries.hasMoreElements()) {\n      \
  \  JarEntry entry = entries.nextElement();\n        // Process the entry\n    }\n\
  } catch (IOException e) {\n    // Handle the exception\n}\n```\n\nUpdate your code\
  \ to replace usages of `Archive.iterator()` with the appropriate usage of `JarFile`\n\
  and revise your logic accordingly to accommodate the new approach.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "JarFile API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/jar/JarFile.html"

  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.SpringApplicationRunListener.running"
    location: "METHOD_CALL"
description: "SpringApplicationRunListener.running method has been removed in Spring\
  \ Boot 3.0"
message: "The method `SpringApplicationRunListener.running(ConfigurableApplicationContext)`\
  \ has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\nTo migrate, replace calls to `running(ConfigurableApplicationContext)`\
  \ with `ready(ConfigurableApplicationContext, Duration)`.\n\nThe `ready` method\
  \ provides a more flexible way to notify that the application is ready, allowing\
  \ the specification of a duration that may be useful for related operations.\nWhen\
  \ updating your code, ensure you replace the method signature to include the necessary\
  \ `Duration` parameter as follows: `ready(context, duration)`.\n\nFor example, you\
  \ can replace:\n```java\nlistener.running(applicationContext);\n```\nWith:\n```java\n\
  listener.ready(applicationContext, Duration.ofSeconds(0));\n```\nAdapt the duration\
  \ as appropriate for your application's requirements.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"

  \ constructor allows you to set the `RabbitProperties` during the creation of your\

  \ practices in Spring Boot.\n\nHere’s an example of how to update your code:\nInstead\
  \ of:\n```java\nAbstractRabbitListenerContainerFactoryConfigurer configurer = new\

Create a rule to find calls to `org.springframework.boot.SpringApplicationRunListener.started`. SpringApplicationRunListener.started(ConfigurableApplicationContext) has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-01030"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3

- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.SpringApplicationRunListener.started"
    location: "METHOD_CALL"
description: "SpringApplicationRunListener.started(ConfigurableApplicationContext)\
  \ has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The method `SpringApplicationRunListener.started(ConfigurableApplicationContext)`\
  \ has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\nThe new method `SpringApplicationRunListener.started(ConfigurableApplicationContext,\
  \ Duration)` has been introduced as part of the updated API.\n\nTo migrate, you\
  \ will need to update your method calls to `started` by adding a `Duration` parameter\
  \ that specifies the duration of the application startup process.\n\nYou can provide\
  \ a `Duration` value based on your application’s needs, or you can use `Duration.ofSeconds(0)`\
  \ as a placeholder if the duration is not critical in your case.\n\nExample migration:\n\
  ```java\n// Old code\nmyListener.started(applicationContext);\n\n// Updated code\n\
  myListener.started(applicationContext, Duration.ofSeconds(0)); // adjust duration\
  \ as necessary\n```\n"
links:

message: "The method `AbstractApplicationContextRunner(Supplier<C>)` has been removed\
  \ in Spring Boot 3.0.\nInstead, use `AbstractApplicationContextRunner(Supplier,\
  \ Function)`, which provides enhanced functionality by allowing the use of a second\
  \ `Function` parameter for additional configuration.\n\nTo migrate, update your\
  \ code to replace any invocations of the method `AbstractApplicationContextRunner(Supplier<C>)`\
  \ with the new method signature `AbstractApplicationContextRunner(Supplier, Function)`.\n\
  Ensure that you provide a `Function` to configure the `ApplicationContext` as necessary.\
  \ This change may involve extracting contextual configurations that were previously\
  \ handled within the `Supplier<C>` call.\n"

    location: "CONSTRUCTOR_CALL"
description: "AbstractApplicationContextRunner constructor with multiple parameters\
  \ has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The constructor `AbstractApplicationContextRunner(Supplier<C>, boolean,\
  \ List<ApplicationContextInitializer<? super C>>,\nTestPropertyValues, TestPropertyValues,\
  \ ClassLoader, ApplicationContext,\nList<AbstractApplicationContextRunner.BeanRegistration<?>>,\
  \ List<Configurations>)` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\nThis constructor\
  \ was previously used for creating application context runners with a variety of\
  \ parameters.\n\nTo migrate, replace usages of the removed constructor with `AbstractApplicationContextRunner(Supplier,\
  \ Function)`.\nThe new constructor simplifies the creation of application context\
  \ runners, accepting fewer parameters. You will only need to\nprovide a `Supplier`\
  \ for the application context and a `Function` to customize the application context.\n\
  \nReview your code to ensure that the configuration you previously set up is appropriately\
  \ captured with the streamlined constructor:\n- Identify and eliminate the parameters\
  \ that are no longer required.\n- Use a `Supplier` to provide the application context.\n\
  - Provide a `Function` for any additional customization.\n\nThis change aligns with\
  \ the modernized Spring Boot practices, promoting cleaner and more maintainable\
  \ test context setup.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"

  \ startup time.\nUpdate your code accordingly to capture this new parameter alongside\

  \ handle the new signature properly and consider how you will obtain the `Duration`\
  \ (for example, measure the startup time of the application).\n"

Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.actuate.health.HealthEndpoint`. HealthEndpoint constructor with 2 arguments has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-01100"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.actuate.health.HealthEndpoint"
    location: "CONSTRUCTOR_CALL"
description: "HealthEndpoint constructor with 2 arguments has been removed in Spring\
  \ Boot 3.0"
message: "The constructor `HealthEndpoint(HealthContributorRegistry, HealthEndpointGroups)`\
  \ has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\nThe new constructor is `HealthEndpoint(HealthContributorRegistry,\
  \ HealthEndpointGroups, Duration)` which adds an additional\n`Duration` parameter\
  \ for configuring the time-to-live of health indicators.\n\nTo migrate, update your\
  \ code to use the new constructor, ensuring that you provide a `Duration` value\
  \ as the third\nparameter. This change allows for better configuration and monitoring\
  \ of the health status of your application.\n\nExample migration:\n```java\nHealthEndpoint\
  \ newHealthEndpoint = new HealthEndpoint(registry, groups, Duration.ofSeconds(30));\n\
  ```\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "HealthEndpoint API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/actuate/health/HealthEndpoint.html"

category: "mandatory"

  \ has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\nThe new constructor requires an additional\
  \ parameter: `HealthEndpointWebExtension(HealthContributorRegistry, HealthEndpointGroups,\
  \ Duration)`.\n\nTo migrate your code, you need to update your method calls to include\
  \ the third parameter, which is of type `Duration`.\nThis additional parameter allows\
  \ for better configuration of health endpoint timeouts and is in line with the changes\
  \ made in the health actuator in Spring Boot 3.0.\n\nTo ensure successful migration,\
  \ review how you are using the method in your existing code and add a suitable `Duration`\
  \ parameter (e.g., `Duration.ofSeconds(30)`) according to your application's requirements.\n"
links:

Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.actuate.autoconfigure.endpoint.expose.IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter(java.lang.Class, org.springframework.core.env.Environment, java.lang.String, org.springframework.boot.actuate.autoconfigure.endpoint.expose.IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes)`. IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-01120"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:

- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.actuate.autoconfigure.endpoint.expose.IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter(java.lang.Class,\
      \ org.springframework.core.env.Environment, java.lang.String, org.springframework.boot.actuate.autoconfigure.endpoint.expose.IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes)"
    location: "CONSTRUCTOR_CALL"
description: "IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The method `IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter(Class<E>, Collection<String>, Collection<String>,\
  \ IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.DefaultIncludes)` has been removed in Spring Boot\
  \ 3.0.\nThis constructor was used for initializing an endpoint filter with specific\
  \ include and exclude criteria.\n\nTo migrate, you should replace usages of this\
  \ constructor with `IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter(Class, Environment, String, String[])`.\
  \ The new constructor provides a way to configure the endpoint filter using the\
  \ specified class type, Spring's `Environment`, the base path, and an array of string\
  \ patterns for filtering.\n\nYou will need to adjust your code to instantiate `IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter`\
  \ using the new constructor signature, ensuring that you provide the necessary parameters\
  \ accordingly. Refer to the Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide for specifics on how\
  \ to set up the environment and filter parameters.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/actuate/autoconfigure/endpoint/expose/IncludeExcludeEndpointFilter.html"

  \ 3.0.\nThis method was used to create a new `Packager` instance with a `File` and\
  \ a `LayoutFactory`.\n\nTo migrate, replace usages of `Packager(File, LayoutFactory)`\
  \ with `Packager(File)`. The new constructor only requires a `File` argument and\
  \ follows the updated practices for packaging applications.\n\nEnsure that the functionality\
  \ provided by `LayoutFactory` is adequately handled elsewhere in your code to maintain\
  \ the desired packaging behavior.\n"
links:

- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.amqp.RabbitTemplateConfigurer"

description: "RabbitTemplateConfigurer() has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The class `RabbitTemplateConfigurer` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\n\
  Instead, you should use `RabbitTemplateConfigurer(RabbitProperties)` which now takes\
  \ `RabbitProperties` as an argument.\n\nTo migrate, update your code where `RabbitTemplateConfigurer`\
  \ is invoked without parameters, and replace it with `RabbitTemplateConfigurer(RabbitProperties)`\
  \ ensuring that you provide the appropriate `RabbitProperties` instance when you\
  \ instantiate `RabbitTemplateConfigurer`.\n\nAlso, review how your application is\
  \ configured for RabbitMQ properties, as the handling may differ between the two\
  \ versions. You can find examples and best practices in the migration guide.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
- title: "RabbitTemplateConfigurer API documentation"
  url: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/api/org/springframework/boot/autoconfigure/amqp/RabbitTemplateConfigurer.html"

  \ of type `Duration`, which allows you to specify the timeout duration\nfor reactive\
  \ health checks. Update your instantiation of `ReactiveHealthEndpointWebExtension`\

  \ correctly with the updated health checks.\n"

when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.devtools.restart.classloader.RestartClassLoader"
    location: "CONSTRUCTOR_CALL"
description: "RestartClassLoader constructor with Log parameter has been removed in\
  \ Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The constructor `RestartClassLoader(ClassLoader, URL[], ClassLoaderFileRepository,\
  \ Log)` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\nThis constructor was previously used\
  \ to create a `RestartClassLoader` instance with an additional `Log` parameter for\
  \ logging purposes.\n\nTo migrate, replace any usages of this constructor with the\
  \ new constructor `RestartClassLoader(ClassLoader, URL[], ClassLoaderFileRepository)`.\n\
  The new constructor does not take a `Log` parameter, as logging can now be handled\
  \ by alternative means.\nEnsure that any logging functionality that relied on the\
  \ `Log` parameter is appropriately refactored to utilize Spring's logging capabilities\
  \ or custom logging solutions.\n"
links:

category: "mandatory"

- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.amqp.SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactoryConfigurer"
    location: "CONSTRUCTOR_CALL"
description: "SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactoryConfigurer() constructor has been\
  \ removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The constructor `SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactoryConfigurer()` has been\
  \ removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\nIt has been replaced with `SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactoryConfigurer(RabbitProperties)`\
  \ which allows you to configure\na `SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory` with a\
  \ set of RabbitMQ properties.\n\nTo migrate, update your code by replacing any calls\
  \ to the no-argument constructor with the new constructor that requires\nan instance\
  \ of `RabbitProperties`. You will need to create a `RabbitProperties` bean and pass\
  \ it to the constructor.\n\nExample migration:\n```java\nRabbitProperties rabbitProperties\
  \ = new RabbitProperties();\nSimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactoryConfigurer configurer\
  \ = new SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactoryConfigurer(rabbitProperties);\n```\n\
  \nEnsure that you adjust any further configurations according to your application's\
  \ needs and the properties you require.\n"
links:

  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"

Create a rule to detect usage of `org.springframework.boot.jdbc.DatabaseDriver.GAE`. DatabaseDriver.GAE has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-removals-01200"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 2
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.boot.jdbc.DatabaseDriver.GAE"
description: "DatabaseDriver.GAE has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0"
message: "The constant `DatabaseDriver.GAE` has been removed in Spring Boot 3.0.\n\
  This constant was previously used to represent the Google App Engine database driver.\n\
  Since there is no direct alternative provided, you will need to review your application\
  \ logic and determine how to handle database connections for Google App Engine.\n\
  \nConsider replacing any usages of `DatabaseDriver.GAE` with appropriate logic for\
  \ your application, or if necessary, refactor your code to accommodate other database\
  \ driver options, depending on your setup.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 migration guide"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#review-dependencies"
Create a rule to detect reactiveuserdetailsservice is no longer auto-configured.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-security-00000"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  and:
  - java.referenced:
      pattern: "org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration"
      location: "ANNOTATION"
    as: "authManager"
    ignore: true
  - java.referenced:
      pattern: "org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationManagerResolver"
      filepaths: "{{authManager.Filepaths}}"
    from: "authManager"
description: "ReactiveUserDetailsService is no longer auto-configured"
message: "A `ReactiveUserDetailsService` is no longer auto-configured in the presence\
  \ of an `AuthenticationManagerResolver`.\nIf your application relies on `ReactiveUserDetailService`\
  \ despite the presence of an `AuthenticationManagerResolver`,\ndefine your own `ReactiveUserDetailsService`\
  \ bean that meets its needs.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Spring Security"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#reactiveuserdetailsservice"
Create a rule to find content matching `spring\.security\.saml2\.relyingparty\.registration\..*\.identity-provider` in .*\.properties. SAML2 relying party configuration.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-security-00010"
category: "mandatory"

- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  builtin.filecontent:
    pattern: "spring\\.security\\.saml2\\.relyingparty\\.registration\\..*\\.identity-provider"
    filePattern: ".*\\.properties"

message: "Support for properties under spring.security.saml2.relyingparty.registration.{id}.identity-provider\n\
  have been removed. Use the new properties under spring.security.saml2.relyingparty.registration.{id}.asserting-party\n\
  as a replacement.\n"
links:

  link: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#saml2-relying-party-configuration"
Create a rule to find content matching `spring\.session\.store-type` in .*\.properties. Store type explicit config no longer supported.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-session-00000"
category: "mandatory"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  builtin.filecontent:
    pattern: "spring\\.session\\.store-type"
    filePattern: ".*\\.properties"
description: "Store type explicit config no longer supported"
message: "Explicitly configuring the store type for Spring session via `spring.session.store-type`\
  \ is no longer supported.\nIn case multiple session store repository implementations\
  \ are detected on the classpath, a fixed order is used to\ndetermine which SessionRepository\
  \ should be auto-configured. If Spring Boot’s defined ordering doesn’t meet your\n\
  needs, you can define your own `SessionRepository` bean and cause the auto-configuration\
  \ to back off.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Spring batch"
  link: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#spring-session-store-type"
- title: "Spring documentation - Spring session"
  link: "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.0.x/reference/html/web.html#web.spring-session"
Create a rule to find content matching `server\.max-http-header-size` in .*\.properties. server.max-http-header-size has been deprecated for migration purposes.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-webapp-changes-00000"
category: "optional"
effort: 1
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  builtin.filecontent:
    filePattern: ".*\\.properties"
    pattern: "server\\.max-http-header-size"
description: "server.max-http-header-size has been deprecated"
message: "Previously, the `server.max-http-header-size` was treated inconsistently\
  \ across the four supported embedded web\nservers. When using Jetty, Netty, or Undertow\
  \ it would configure the max HTTP request header size.\nWhen using Tomcat it would\
  \ configure the max HTTP request and response header sizes.\n\nTo address this inconsistency,\
  \ `server.max-http-header-size` has been deprecated and a replacement,\n`server.max-http-request-header-size`,\
  \ has been introduced. Both properties now only apply to the request header\nsize,\
  \ irrespective of the underlying web server.\n\nTo limit the max header size of\
  \ an HTTP response on Tomcat or Jetty (the only two servers that support such\n\
  a setting), use a `WebServerFactoryCustomizer`.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Web application changes"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#servermax-http-header-size"
Write a rule to find classes that implement `org.springframework.context.SmartLifecycle`. Updated Phases for Graceful Shutdown.

---
ruleID: "spring-boot-2.x-to-3.0-webapp-changes-00010"
category: "potential"
effort: 3
labels:
- "konveyor.io/source=spring-boot2"
- "konveyor.io/target=spring-boot3+"
when:
  java.referenced:
    pattern: "org.springframework.context.SmartLifecycle"
    location: "IMPLEMENTS_TYPE"
description: "Updated Phases for Graceful Shutdown"
message: "The phases used by the `SmartLifecycle` implementations for graceful shutdown\
  \ have been updated. Graceful shutdown\nnow begins in phase `SmartLifecycle.DEFAULT_PHASE`\
  \ - 2048 and the web server is stopped in phase\n`SmartLifecycle.DEFAULT_PHASE`\
  \ - 1024. Any `SmartLifecycle` implementations that were participating\nin graceful\
  \ shutdown should be updated accordingly.\n"
links:
- title: "Spring Boot 3.0 Migration Guide - Web application changes"
  url: "https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-3.0-Migration-Guide#updated-phases-for-graceful-shutdown"
